name: (learning) ROCK PAPER SCISSORS
description:
can you beat the machine?

This is a technical test in the area of self-learning AI, starting from the most basic possible game that it can be applied to. The setup here is very simple, but can obviously very easily be expanded upon. An AI framework is just the framework, and obviously its functions, input, and output are secondary to how it “thinks”.

This is a game of rock-paper-scissors.

Your opponent is an AI. It learns. A counter tells you exactly how many games IE cycles of data, have been input into the AIs brain. The more data it has, the more it’s trained against you.

How long can you last here, before this bot has you 100% figured out?

If you change your tactics, how quickly can the bot keep up?

Are you clever enough to beat the crudest, simplest, learning AI that i can currently construct?

MUSIC CREDIT

-TechnoAxe

-stellardrone
